sub_title: Sustainable water development for climate change adaptation
summary:
Professional in sustainable water management and adaptation to climate change. My systems thinking approach allows me to combine qualitative and quantitative tools, as well as key sociotechnical aspects in solving problems around water resources. I have international experience working in public, private and cooperation entities; coordinating with local actors in the development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of projects with an emphasis on climate change. I conducted my undergraduate studies at the Zamorano EAP University in socioeconomic development and environment engineering. I have a double MSc. degree in water management for rural development from the Universities of Wageningen UR and Montpellier SupAgro. Likewise, I have a MSc. degree in water systems engineering, with specialization in territorial development and water resources for food security at UNESCO IHE. My training and work experience allow me to easily work in multicultural environments with multidisciplinary teams.
•	My main technical skills are: Data collection and processing, systems approach, climate change, GIS, remote sensing; I also have knowledge of the use and application of water and hydraulic models and programming.
•	I am proficient in the following languages: Spanish (native), English(C2) and French(B1).
•	The values and social skills that characterize me are: Teamwork, responsibility and problem solving

In addition, I closely coordinate with national and local stakeholders such as ministries, municipalities, neighbourhood councils and irrigators. In this initiative I contribute to study the conditions for wastewater reuse from existing or planned projects at rural and urban scales, considering IWRM approach and decentralized treatments. I am responsible for analysing water and sludge treatment and management, governance, irrigation reuse and its economy for agricultural production, environmental and sanitary risk management. I carry out the analysis and systematization of existing normative, technical and research documents on reuse in the country. I also do fieldwork and conduct interviews and questionnaires.', 'title': 'Operador Nacional', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 896490, 'name': 'CONDESAN', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQFkSsc2_dmVbA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519910652305?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=wlusdA0qIv_56DCR4OOtVWnT-F3TGx67IVGOJ5E3ZIU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/condesan/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Cochabamba, Bolivia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'CONDESAN', 'description': 'climate change specialist for the Andes Project Adaptation to the Impacts of Climate Change on Water Resources (AICCA) in Bolivia. With the project, we promote the development of structural and non-structural measures for climate change adaptation. Among the most relevant actions are: the implementation of a Sustainable Urban Drainage Systems SUDS Pilot; the development of guides and technical regulations with a climate change focus, such as the guide for the delimitation of security strips, the methodological guide for determining the risk of floods and dungeons (which included water modeling with climate change scenarios), the guide for waste management. The above, based on a comprehensive approach based on green solutions (based on nature) in combination with gray and non-structural measures for drainage and stormwater management in urban basins.
